snippet: From the Palma Boy Social Club to the Isaac Newton Middle School, Harlem's Pleasant Avenue has changed.
abstract: From the Palma Boy Social Club to the Isaac Newton Middle School, Harlem's Pleasant Avenue has changed.
lead_paragraph: On a December night in 2003, at Rao's, the legendary restaurant on Pleasant Avenue in East Harlem, a man nicknamed Louie Lump Lump shot another patron after reportedly taking issue with his disparaging comment about the female singer's rendition of "Don't Rain on My Parade" from "Funny Girl." The incident felt like a tale from a bygone era and garnered a great deal of giddily nostalgic local press. One patron told The Daily News, "I was surprised. Things like that don't happen here." At least not in recent decades.

headline.main: Where Lupo the Wolf Goes for Dinner
